reviews.review_msg: Online quizzes, no midterm no final. the easiest HSCI class you will take. lectures were SO boring but aren't mandatory. very very very easy class and very nice prof. Can't emphasize enough how easy this class was and how worth it is taking with him. every. other review that says this class is hard is lying. only trust this one
Super sweet guy. Class consisted of 2 quizzes/midterms, weekly short presentations, reflections, and a final art project. Dr. Hogg was always very caring and kind. Chill class too.
lemme tell u wsp. his lectures are not too engaging, but he is so nice and caring! the class is overall pretty simple, make sure you do well on the first quiz.

Really sweet and knowledgeable prof who's really passionate about what he teaches but lectures get boring and he reads off the slides. Both midterms (worth 25% and 15%) were online and openbook. Does in class group projects like creating posters. Super easy just hard to sit through class and not fall asleep. Amazing guy tho

He is very knowledgeable and respectful. Lectures are not too long, over an hour of each class goes to small group discussions. Easy short weekly presentation slides before each class based on the reading material. Midterm was hard with some confusing questions, the final project is very creative and relatively easy to get good marks.

Dr. Hogg is a monotone teacher that the lectures tend to be boring. It is mandatory to go to class because of group work. But, I feel like he will mark you present even though you are absent. I didn't really learn a lot because he reads through the lecture slides and skips over some lectures so we can read them in our own time

Midterm was insanely stupid. Worth 40%, refused to give us any heads up on what would be on it, then is shocked when the average was 45%. He really does not care about teaching the class at all. None of his assignments have any criteria and even the TAs aren't sure how to help us.

barely put any effort into this class partially because the content was boring. TAs marked tutorial assignments a bit harshly but were nice overall. The prof is monotone and its very easy to fall asleep in lecture. 2 quizzes one worth 20% and the other 30% are straight from lecture notes. NO need to attend lectures, just read the slides.

I only attended the first lecture then I stopped attending lectures as I was falling asleep. Overall, the grading criteria for the course was very unclear, with the syllabus outlining one format for an assignment and the prof's lecture slides describing a completely different format!

prof hogg was a fairly decent professor, have definitely had worse but have also had better. his lectures were fairly dry but he was really passionate about what he was teaching. the first exam was very difficult but the second one was very easy. there is no textbook which i also appreciated but a book and an art project due for the final.

Lectures drag on a lot. I didnt attend any of the classes even though it was in person. 2 major quizzes that have answers straight off the lecture slides. you dont even need to study for the quizzes, everything is on the slides and its open book. final project was easy peasy did it in 2 days. He is very boring but very easy

Robert Hogg is probably one of the best profs I have had so far at SFU. He includes random dad jokes during his lectures but they are quite comical. Even though he tends to read off the lecture slides, he is very open to giving you extra material if you ask. I wouldn't recommend buying the textbook as I personally didn't use it once. Rlly nice guy!

Lectures are an mp3 of him reading his slides. Quiz questions were confusing even though they were verbatim of the slides. To do well in this class, don't think too hard, the obvious is the answer. Only had one interesting lecture on HIV, which is his specialty. Would take class again for a quick pass.

I would NOT take this class with this prof ever again. Very boring lectures and assignments that make you want to just get it over with instead of learning something. As a final, he gave us an art project with a write up for which he GRADED our artwork. I signed up for health sci, not an art class. Generally, a bad class layout.

idk why his rating is so low i took his course in spring 2020 and hes a good prof in my opinion compared to what the ratings here say. the lectures are a bit heavy and boring though but his tests are fair, no surprises. he's a funny guy and he was super considerate and nice.

Dr. Hogg is a good professor but his lectures drag on and are boring at times. His quizzes and tests are not hard but it is really easy to make stupid mistakes. I might've done better if I was not in an online environment in his class.
Super nice guy, but the lectures were confusing and super long. Lots of quizzes and readings.

Was a great prof! Tends to read off the slides making class a little boring, however, there are end of class quizzes that you MUST complete. You just need to study the lecture slides to pass the tests. Overall, this is an easy class that you just need to put in a little bit of effort for!

I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot. The lectures are not too heavy and there is no final which is amazing. The midterms are more difficult than you would assume but you can easily get a really good grade if you study a couple days before. Robert is really entertaining and the class was overall pretty fun and not stressful.

I found that he was fair and gave you the reigns on how you wanted to receive the information he's open to making up for missed classes but its your responsibility to do so. Lectures were a bit long but you only have one class a week! he is honest about whats going to be on the exam and isn't self absorbed-he is my favourite teacher at sfu so far!

Do not recommend this professor. I would've done better on this course if I didn't have him as my professor. Very disorganized. In his syllabus it said he would provide us with video recordings. He never because he does not know how to. Makes you buy the textbook because "his friend wrote it". Assignments are VERY vague. DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR HSCI130

He seemed so disinterested in teaching this class. Made comments about how he didn't really look at the assignment outline as he was drinking beer with the family. Promised bonus marks that disappeared when assignment was marked. Very unclear about the assignments - it was a joke pretty much. I would avoid taking any classes with him.

Robert Hogg is probably one of the best profs I had in SFU. Its true, he tells random dad jokes during lecture but I find them funny. Even though he tends to read off the lecture slides, you honestly can get a good grade studying only of those slides. No textbook, just the PowerPoint slides. Classes are mandatory for days you have quizzes.

Dr. Hogg is good natured and likes to crack jokes. He posts lecture slides, and there was no specific textbook for this class. Exams were fair, but the written parts were a bit tricky. The final project was different - response to a book and an art piece. Attendance is mandatory for the pop quizzes, dates are in the outline.

You need to go to lecture as he has in class activities which are easy if you stay for the whole thing. The lecture slides are helpful+ quizzes aren't bad plus no final! BUT he is super unclear about his expectations for assignments and to TA's, we had a art based book review and the criteria he posted was nothing like what he explained later

He's a little disorganized, especially with criteria's for projects and written assignments. He tends to read off slides during lecture, but his exams are simple and straight off the slides. Tutorial participation, commentary, & the project are an easy grade booster. Attendance is only mandatory on the days you have in-class assignments.

He's a weird guy. His exams were easy but the written portions were tricky. Good thing is that the class had no final but there is a book review/wack art project- he changed the criteria already stated in the syllabus for the book review which was confusing

I really enjoyed this class. I felt that it was a good mix of readings, videos, projects, and lectures. I am not very strong in terms of hard sciences so I had to get a tutor for some of the concepts but I ended up doing well. Bob is really sweet and awkward and tells the best dad jokes! Make sure you get a good TA, it'll make all the difference.

Study what you're give. Material is mostly taught from online readings/textbooks and his slides. He tends to be very  unclear when he lectures and often goes off topic. Go to your TA if you need help because he will often give you a confusing answer and he often admits he's not familiar with a lot of the HSCI 130 course material. Wouldn't recommend

Great prof! I found the lectures really interesting (even though they are long) and you can tell Dr. Hogg is an expert in his field. The two midterms really aren't that hard if you study the lecture slides, and the tutorial presentation is really simple. I wouldn't recommend buying the textbook though because so far we have used it for one reading.

Robert tries to make class interesting and tries to crack some jokes. He knows he reads off slides so he has improved on that. Overall his class is pretty straightforward. One of the most easy going profs I've had so far.

Only con I would say would be that he is monotone so it is hard to focus sometimes. But he really encourages questions and does not make you feel stupid. Really nice guy and likes to crack jokes here and there. Tutorial presentation and assignments are an easy grade booster as long as you put a little effort.
easy course if you study the lecture notes.

2 Quizzes (Midterms), moderately difficult and 4 assignments (quizzes) straight off the slides. When he was in lecture, interesting. No need for book... even for the mandatory for book report. Must go to tutorial!!

Very interesting class. Dr. Hogg is a good lecturer however, it is apparent that at times he himself does not fully understand what he is teaching. There was no final. Instead we had 2 quizzes worth 25% each of which the questions were fair. We had in-class exercises and tutorial presentations. A unique art-based book report was the last assignment
Great prof!
Best prof I have ever had, so funny. Never given such a deserved hot chilli pepper!!!!!

Dr Hogg is a world-renowned HIV expert. Yes he brings in guest speakers, but that means students are exposed to not just one, but MANY experts in the field. This rarely happens in undergrad courses. He's in high demand to speak all around the world so its pretty amazing to have him as your prof, no matter how many times he lectures.

As expert as it gets when it comes to HIV. He's funny and great at teaching, but I was surprised as to how many guest lecturers there were in an HIV class when Dr. Hogg is an HIV expert. Overall, the class is informative but you really have to know your stuff to ace the exams.

so his supposed expertise is HIV and this is an HIV class and i didn't learn anything whatsoever. he did not lecture half the time. one time attendance was worth 10%. no clear course outline and provided rubric for a paper 2 days before its due. its a miracle i got an A.
He was clear, he made the material interesting.  Great sense of humour!
I really hate the guest lecturers. Your TA will be your marker. So choose TA wisely. B/c some TA could give you low partipation mark even though you attend all tutorials.

212 is not Mr. Hogg's area of expertise. He only taught a handful of lectures; the rest were guest speakers. He's kinda funny which makes class bearable but I'd avoid him as prof. WIth all the different speakers, the notes were not uniform. Makes studying for midterm and final very difficult cuz we cover so much material and way in depth.
He doesn't deserve to get paid. He doesn't do any teaching except for one or two lectures. Exams are long. Know your stuff.

So boring! He's really not a good prof at all...he hardly even taught us. We had so many guest lecturers, which then made studying for the exams kind of difficult, as there was no uniformity to the notes. The TA's were also pretty useless...all we did in tutorials were our presentations, they never reviewed much of the actual course material.

Dr. Hogg's pretty lazy. Out of all the classes, he only lectured a handful. The majority of the time we had guest lecturers. He doesn't really know too much about anything other than HIV, which is his expertise. So when asked questions about other topics, his answer is often "I'm not sure."

Boring but easy. He reads directly off of the ppt notes most of the time.  No need to attend his lectures or buy the textbook. Just make sure you attend the guest lectures and study his ppt notes religiously. Midterm, final and assignments were pretty fair. It's relatively easy to do well in his class.
His lectures are kind of dry but he has great ppt notes. Exams were pretty fair. No need to buy textbook, just study lecture notes. Overall the class was pretty easy.
Classes are unbearably boring. No need to attend classes because he read the ppt slide. Do not buy text books because it is not necessary at all notes are good enough.

Bob is a terrible prof. He reads off his ppt slides and is unbearably boring. TA is pretty important in this class cuz you are not gonna understand much from Bob's lectures. The second part of the class is easier than the first but a pretty easy class nonetheless. No need to buy the book, its a waste. Just study the slides in detail.

We had two profs for this course (Hogg and Angela Kaida). Kaida was definitely a better lecturer but Dr. Hogg's ppt notes were pretty good nonetheless. Lectures were boring though cause he reads directly from his notes most of the time. There's not much need to even go to class, just study his notes and you should do fine.
boring lecturer - powerpoints were concise; mt and final all taken from powerpoints so no need to go to lecture. TA was not helpful - didn't care about students, barely went through concepts

When asked a question by students in class, he shrugs and says "I don't know about that one." Doesn't bother answering the questions... His lectures (as mentioned below) are boring and dry and he just reads straight off of the lecture slides. He spends most of the class talking about absolutely nothing. Waste of time...

Super boring lecturer. He's supposed to be famous for research, but he can't teach at all. Everything he says is straight from his slides. His voice is somewhat soft and is hard to concentrate esp when the class begins to talk from how boring the class is. Midterm & final straight from ppt notes. Wished the lectures were recorded.
Read straight from lecture slides, was more concerned with his own research. The TA's were useless.
the course book is pretty useless. and all he does is read straight off his lecture slides. waste of time... NOT recommended with this prof! take tucker! Dont know about his midterms yet
Easy enough class, but he doesn't really care about teaching it.  Seemed more concerned with his research.
such a nice person & funny guy. cares abt students. easy mt & final. book report is interesting too

Lectures were boringg because he reads off the notes like 99% of the time, could not control class noise level well..Exams are fair and relevant, maybe because he was sharing with another prof (Kaida)Study powerpoint notes and attend guest lectures and you will do fine on them. Guest lectures were interesting. An alright prof, and not a bad course.

Bob is a great teacher!  His style may be different from other profs, but I found it refreshing.  His jokes are funny and when he covers material, he makes it interesting.  Exam wasn't easy, but wasn't terribly hard.  Make sure to attend tutorial and take your time with assignments/presentation to get an A.

He did an awful job with this course.  Lectures were painful - he read off his slides instead of actually lecturing - it was like he wasd learning the material with the students at the same time.  Midterm wasn't related to course material, final was bettter.  Did not use the text book at all. Did not control the class at all, students were loud.
His class is a bit boring, but he'll throw in a few jokes here and there to make it a bit interesting.  Class was a waste of time. Exams were fair, and pretty easy with giving out part marks.

Bob is a nice guy, good researcher, but a lousy teacher!  He does not know anything about infectious disease as that is not his specialty.  Feedback on his assignments is non-existant.  Only saving grace of this course are the excellent TAs.
Could not keep the class controlled, was way too loud and the material on the exam did not reflect what was taught in class whatsoever. Complete waste of my time.
Not quite his area of study -- but he held his own throughout the course. Showed effort in keeping the class entertain while still learning. Generally improving as an undergrad prof.
Very interesting course on HIV/AIDS! The professor is very friendly. Would have liked more feedback on presentations and other assessments (e.g. grades posted on WebCT).

This is a really laid back professor. Personally, I don't mind him, he's a really nice guy and very approachable. Very responsive to student concerns. I'll be taking another course with him in the summer =)

Awful Prof! Seems to think the class is a joke, always starts late (up to 15 minutes late for a fifty minute lecture). Doesn't know the answer to questions he is asked. Sometimes doesn't even know the answer to questions he asks. I Do not recommend him!
